TopicSection.Content:
Spread.Views is a comprehensive grid control that lets you design web application where user can combine normal grid features along with row templates, multiple grouping strategies, multiple item layout engines, DAX like calculations, better touch experiences and various other features.

A basic grid generated using Spread.Views is shown below:

 

Use the following steps to add a basic grid to a browser page.

  1. Add JavaScript to the HTML page. The following code is a general example.

    Type your example code here. It will be automatically colorized when you switch to Preview or build the help system. HTML HTML CodeSamples\views_sample1\views_sample1\101_intro.html main
  2. Add reference scripts. Spread.Views provides minified and debugged versions of the scripts.
    The "spreadgrid.js" supports the core features of Spread.Views and "jQuery.min" is for the foundation of Spread.Views.

    JavaScript JS

    <script src="[Your_Scripts_Path]/jquery.min.js"></script>
    <script src="[Your_Scripts_Path]/spreadgrid.js"></script>
    <script src="[Your_Scripts_Path]/globalize.js"></script>
    <script src="[Your_Scripts_Path]/lodash.min.js"></script>
    <script src="[Your_Scripts_Path]/formatter.js"></script>
    <script src="[Your_Scripts_Path]/functions.js"></script>


  3. Add the CSS files to customize the appearance. Use the "spreadgrid.css" file for the default appearance.

    JavaScript JS <link rel="stylesheet" href="[Your_CSS_Path]/site.css" type="text/css">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="[Your_CSS_Path]/spreadgrid.css" type="text/css">
  4. Implement the initialization code. This example initializes the Spread.Views control in a DOM (Document Object Model) element with an id of "grid1".

    Type your example code here. It will be automatically colorized when you switch to Preview or build the help system. JavaScript JS CodeSamples\views_sample1\views_sample1\101_intro.html initialize
  5. Create the DOM element that is the target of the Spread.Views control.

    Type your example code here. It will be automatically colorized when you switch to Preview or build the help system. HTML HTML CodeSamples\views_sample1\views_sample1\101_intro.html DOM
